subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: Note that in Japanese and Korean (printed forms), the [[亠]] component on top is written [[二]] (as found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}). In traditional/simplified Chinese and Vietnamese, the top component is written [[丶]]. In written Japanese, the top component may be written either [[一]], [[丶]] or [[丨]] (small vertical stroke).

subSections.title: See also

subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology
subSections.text: According to Schuessler (2007: 74) this word is derived from {{och-l|語|id=1|to speak}} + ''-n'' nominal suffix.
